sources.description: Hydroelectric power is generated by the force of falling water. The water is stored in a reservoir behind a dam, and the force of the water falling from the reservoir through a turbine spins the turbine, which generates electricity. The amount of electricity generated depends on the volume of water and the height of the dam.
sources.maxUnitExplanation:
The river behind the marae dairy farm is well-suited to micro-scale hydroelectric turbine units. Each unit produces about 8,000 kWh of electricity annually. There is enough space along the river for a maximum of 3 units.\nThe electricity generated from this source could be used to power the dairy farm equipment, electric space heaters, electric water boilers, and electronics across the marae.\nWhy not more?
The size of a river determines the size of a turbine unit, as well as how many units can be installed. To minimise impact on the river’s health, only 3 units can be installed, and they are relatively small units to accommodate the narrowness of this river. Additionally, excess electricity from the turbines can be temporarily stored in batteries. But to efficiently use this energy, daily hydroelectric energy production should not be greater than the daily energy demand of the community.

sources.description: Fossil fuels are non-renewable energy sources that are formed from the remains of plants and animals that lived millions of years ago. The most common fossil fuels are coal, oil, and natural gas. Fossil fuels are burned to produce electricity, which releases carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases into the atmosphere.
sources.maxUnitExplanation:
The marae’s living spaces are equipped with hot water and heating.The kitchen is also equipped with a gas-powered stove and oven. \nThermal energy, from boilers that burn natural gas, can directly meet these needs. The boilers can heat tap water and provide radiative heating. Natural gas can also fuel kitchen appliances for cooking.\nWhy not more?
On average, about 63% of a home’s electricity usage goes toward heating and hot water. Another 7% is used for cooking. Because the marae is off the grid, its heating, hot water, and cooking needs can be met by thermal energy from gas-powered devices. For communities connected to the electricity grid, these same devices might be either electricity-powered or gas-powered.

sources.description: Geothermal energy is heat from the Earth’s core. It is a renewable energy source that can be used to generate electricity. Geothermal power plants use the heat from the Earth’s core to heat water and produce steam. The steam spins a turbine, which generates electricity.
sources.maxUnitExplanation:
The marae’s living spaces are equipped with heating. Underground heat in geothermally active areas can be used to heat buildings for small communities. There is space at the marae to install up to 3 geothermal heating units, each providing about 4,000 kWh of heat energy annually.\nGeothermal heating units harness heat from below ground to warm buildings and keep them at a comfortable temperature.\nWhy not more?
On average, about 34% of a home’s electricity usage goes toward heating. Because the marae is off the grid, its heating needs can be met by thermal energy harnessed by the geothermal units. Large-scale geothermal power plants are capable of generating a great deal of thermal energy and converting it into electricity. However, a community must be connected to the electricity grid to receive this form of geothermal power.

sources.description: Solar panels convert sunlight into electricity. They are made up of many solar cells that are connected together. When sunlight hits the solar cells, it creates an electric field that generates electricity. Solar panels are a renewable energy source that can be used to power homes and businesses.
sources.maxUnitExplanation:
Near the sports pitch, the marae has space to install a micro-scale solar array. There is space for up to 4 units, and each unit is capable of producing 5,000 kWh of electricity annually. \nThe electricity generated from this source could be used to power the dairy farm equipment, electric space heaters, electric water boilers, and electronics across the marae (including lights for the sports pitch!).\nWhy not more?
Because solar panels can only produce electricity on sunny days, the solar array must be connected to large batteries that store electricity for use later on, such as at night. Excess electricity cannot be stored for very long, so solar energy production each day should not be greater than the daily energy demand of the community. Solar arrays are expensive to install, and represent a significant investment.

sources.description: Wind turbines convert the kinetic energy of the wind into electricity. The wind turns the blades of the turbine, which spins a generator that produces electricity. Wind turbines are a renewable energy source that can be used to power homes and businesses.
sources.maxUnitExplanation:
Past the garden, there is a hill well-suited to hosting micro-scale wind turbines. There is space for up to 4 units, each capable of producing about 4,000 kWh of electricity annually.\nThe electricity generated from this source could be used to power the dairy farm equipment, electric space heaters, electric water boilers, and electronics across the marae.\nWhy not more?
Wind turbines must be arranged with specific orientation to the landscape and each other, in order to most efficiently capture wind currents. The space available at the marae can only accommodate 4 turbines of this size. They can only be used when there is sufficient wind. Excess electricity from the turbines can be stored in batteries, but not for very long. So wind energy production each day should not be greater than the daily energy demand of the community.
